pages.text: Tamed animals need roughly two food and one bottle of water each day.$(br2)Farm animals eat and drink from troughs, and need straw or grass to sleep on.$(br2)Zoo animals eat from food barrels, drink from cauldrons or water bowls, and need enrichment items to avoid boredom.
Once you've spent a while in an area, highly aggressive raiders will start to spawn.

Some raider spawners can activate even when fully lit up. Be careful when exploring ruins!$(br2)Rats and raiders will ruin your crops and rob your chests if they can, so protect them well.$(br2)Zombies and raiders can break torches, but not lanterns.$(br2)Build livestock pen walls 3m high to prevent escapes.
You can tame a rat by dropping cheese near it. One rat can eat 10 to 16 cheese.
Desert mountaintops can be dangerous during storms; that's when the air elementals called Blitzes spawn.
Deep underground in mountainous regions, you might encounter the earth elementals called Basalzes.
Deathworms can only burrow through sand, but they have a long lunge that can break blocks.
You can harvest a dragon skeleton by right-clicking it with an empty hand.
Adult dragons lair in underground caves. Look for clusters of ore flowers in the desert.
